body.p:
To His Excellency
Gov. Thomas E. Bramblette

The Undersigned Citizens and residents of the County of Bath, would respectfully Represent, That at the March, Term 1858, of the Bath Circuit Court a fine of $20, and costs was recovered by the Commonwealth against Ephraim Gooden. Also at the September Term 1858, of the same Court another fine of $60, was made against him for keeping a Tipling House and retailing with out license, each of which fines were recovered without defense being made to the indictments.

We would further represent That said Gooden is a peaceable loyal and law abiding citizen, That he is a poor man in bad health; and that now if he had those fines remitted would be able to make something for the support, of his family. We do think this one a case in which the exercise of your clemency would be right and Just to all --
August 10th 1865.

Thos. P. Daugherty
J J Lightfoot
J, A Dunnbar
Stephen Terhune
Gore Burgess
Isaac Wrenchy
Jno J Swetman jr
T B Hamilton P, J, B, C, C,
R. Coulthard C. B. C. C.
Daniel Harper S, B, C,
John O. Rice
M, G Jones
Richard Donaldson
Geo Abraham
Samuel McQuarthy

Bath Cir Ct
vs
E Gooden
$20 & $60.
Remitted 6 Oct 1865
